summary:
Horror films are all about scaring and grossing out the audience. They often feature monsters, creepy stories, and dark themes. The genre started with silent movies and got its official start with the 1931 film *Dracula*.

Over time, horror has grown with many different types, like monster movies, scary comedies, and psychological thrillers. These films are popular worldwide, especially in Japan, Korea, and Thailand. Even though they can be controversial, some horror movies and franchises have become huge hits and part of popular culture. An example is the iconic vampire movie *Nosferatu* (1922).
